page.title: 05Ecology-Pamber Forest (ctd.)
page.content: Notably such plants as the 'Early Purple Orchid' and the 'Moschatel'. Pamber Forest is coppiced woodland, mainly hazel coppice (or stools as they are known locally) with oak standard.It has been 25 years since the last major coppicing and it is only over the last 2 years that coppicing has been reintroduced. It is proposed that approximately 300, 80 to 100 year old oaks are to be felled to widen the forest rides. Reasons:(i)to increase the diversity of flora and fauna along the edge of these rides.(ii)to give more growth room to some of the existing oaks. {Flora and Fauna. Pamber Forest contains a wealth of plant and animal life.The following have come from our own observations and details given to us by the warden.
